meanings.definition: To close and open one or both eyes quickly.
meanings.sent1: I blink when the sun is too bright.
meanings.sent2: She blinked in surprise at the sudden noise.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to blink slowly while napping.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse on the shore blinks to guide ships safely.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to blink regularly to keep your eyes moist.

meanings.sent1: In the blink of an eye, the bird flew away.
meanings.sent2: The movie ended in a blink, leaving us wanting more.
meanings.sent3: I missed the goal because I sneezed at the blink of time.
meanings.sent4: Life can change in the blink of a second, so cherish every moment.
meanings.sent5: The blink of a shooting star brought luck to the young couple.

meanings.sent1: The fireflies blink in the dark night sky.
meanings.sent2: The distant city lights blink on the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball blinks in rhythm with the music.
meanings.sent4: The warning light blinks to signal a problem.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign blinks brightly to attract customers.
